common_fell_abilities.common_fell_ability_description: When this creature is fighting hated enemies, all of this creature's attack rolls are Favoured. [Choose one culture that this creature hates].
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is exposed to the full light of the sun.
When this creature is fighting hated enemies, all of this creature's attack rolls are Favoured. [Choose one culture that this creature hates].

Player-heroes can attempt a special combat task against the creature while in Forward stance. The acting player makes a RIDDLE roll as the main action for the round: on a success, the Troll loses 1 point of Hate, plus 1 point for each T rolled.
If a Sting attack results in a Wound, the target is also poisoned.

If attack with the Web quality successfully hits a target, that target is webbed and unable to move. The webbed target cannot change stance and suffers 4 to their Parry rating. The webbed target may free themselves by succeeding on an ATHLETICS roll.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is exposed to the full light of the sun.
All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.

Spend 1 Hate to cancel a Wound. When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, spend 1 Hate to bring the creature back to full Endurance instead. This ability is ineffective against Playe-heroes wielding a magical weapon enchanted with spells for the Bane of the Undead.
The creature is not affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, unless a Magical success is obtained.
Anyone who engages a Nazgul in a close-combat stance immediately gain 2 points of Shadow (Sorcery). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they fall unconcscious.
Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are also made weary for the remainder of the combat.
All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.

At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight. Those who succeed will continue to gain 1 Shadow point (Dread) each round until they fail a Shadow test.

If a hero scores a Piercing Blow against the ringwraith with a non-magical weapon, the hero must immediately succeed on a VALOUR test or have their weapon shattered and they suffer 7 Endurance damage immediately. In addition, the ringwraith cannot suffer injuries from non-magical weapons. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.

Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by uniknąć Rany. Jeżeli atak miałby zredukować twoją Wytrzymałość do zera, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by odzyskać całą Wytrzymałość. Tej zdolności nie można używać, jeżeli Bohater walczy magiczną bronią niosącą Zgubę upiorom.
Nie działa na ciebie Zadanie Bojowe Przeraź Wroga, o ile Bohater nie uzyskał w nim magicznego sukcesu.

Na początku pierwszej rundy potyczki wszyscy Bohaterowie w zasięgu wzroku jednej lub kilku istot posiadających ten Atrybut otrzymują 3 punkty Cienia (Groza). Postaci, którym nie uda się Próba Cienia, są tak przerażone, że nie mogą wydawać Nadziei do końca potyczki.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by zaata-kować dowolnego Bohatera w jakiejkolwiek postawie, nawet Bezpiecznej.

stories.story_description: A terrible berast hunts the Westfold Vale, slaying horses. As the company investigates, they discover a band of Dunlendings hunting the beast, for it has been preying on their peeople too. High up in the White Mountains, the companions must face evil of many kinds to emerge triumphant.
A Dunlending warband under Caselwun and Rhonwen sets the Westfold alight, hoping to draw out the Riders of Rohan. The heroes must fight fire and steel to save the people of the Mark.
The Riders of Rohan march to war against the Dunlendings, but hidden dangers lie in the shadows. The companions must navigate political intrigue and ancient hatreds to prevent a catastrophe.
A haunting specter of a Horse-Lord arises, seeking vengeance for ancient wrongs. As the company delves into the history of Rohan, they must face both the living and the dead.
Orcs of the White Mountains, led by Malthor the Axe-Bitten and Gazhur Three-Deaths, threaten the Mark. The heroes must descend into dark tunnels to end the threat from below.
An unnatural winter grips the land, and dark forces move through the snow. The companions must survive the cold and uncover the source of the winter's curse.
The heroes must escort a merchant and his son through Mirkwood, but dark things linger on the edges of the path, waiting to lead the unwary astray.
The company stumbles upon a secretive and dangerous group in Mirkwood. They must act carefully to avoid becoming the main course of a sinister feast.
A betrayal in the Beorning lands threatens to destabilize the region. The heroes must choose sides and navigate dangerous politics.
The companions must deal with the restless dead, who have risen due to a foul necromancer's influence.
The heroes explore the dismal marshes, where a malevolent force is corrupting the land and its creatures.
An ancient threat awakens in the North, and only those who keep vigil on the heath know of its approach.
Evil stirs once more in the land of Angmar, and the heroes must confront ancient horrors to protect the Free Peoples.
The company is called upon to guard a vital trade route across the heath, but shadows in the wild threaten travelers and merchants alike.
The heroes encounter trolls and other dangers as they traverse the treacherous highlands.
A band of ghostly archers is terrorizing the countryside, and the company must put them to rest.
The heroes join a traveling company of merchants, but not all is as it seems, and betrayal lurks among the wagons.
An ancient evil stirs beneath the ground, and the heroes must descend into darkness to stop it.
The Barrow-downs are haunted by shadows of the past, and the heroes must confront them to recover a lost artifact.
A monstrous troll terrorizes the Bree-land, and the heroes must devise a plan to defeat it.
Mysterious travelers bring trouble to the peaceful lands, and the company must determine their true purpose.
Bandits have taken refuge in the quiet village of Staddle, and the heroes are tasked with driving them out.
The company is hired to recover a valuable artifact, but others seek it as well, leading to dangerous confrontations.
The dwarves of the Blue Mountains need aid in reclaiming an old mine, but dark forces oppose them.
The heroes delve into ancient ruins, where traps and undead guardians await.
A dragon's lair is rumored to hold great treasure, but disturbing it may bring ruin upon the land.
A lake in the wilderness hides a dark secret, and the heroes must uncover it before it consumes the nearby settlements.
The heroes venture into the cold and dangerous North, where the shadow of the past lingers heavily.

adversaries.name: Black Uruk
adversaries.description: Large and evil Orcs of great strength, picked from among the fiercest to act as lieutenants, bodyguards or chosen warriors, sent to reinforce a colony of lesser Orcs.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Snaga Tracker
adversaries.description: A smaller breed gifted with wide, snuffling nostrils, able to catch the scent of enemies from a distance, even after a prolonged period of time has passed. Trackers are a weak and lazy lot, but quick and clever.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, the creature also loses 1 Hate.
When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Messenger of Lugbúrz
adversaries.description: An emissary of the Shadow, a Messenger of Lugbúrz is always on an errand for his Master, be it to spy upon Men, Elves or Dwarves, or to rouse all creatures with evil intent in an area.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Orcs of Mount Gram
adversaries.description: The Orcs of Mount Gram have a long memory of their defeat at the hands of Bullroarer Took and fiercely hate all Hobbits, relentlessly attacking a company that includes one.

adversaries.name: Goblins of Carn Dum
adversaries.description: A small, vicious breed of Orcs still inhabit the ruins of Carn Dum. There they hide, when they don’t prowl the land with war-bands led by warriors of the Hill-men of Rhudaur, who profit from the Goblins’ abilities as scouts and look-outs. The Goblins both hate and fear those who defeated their master, the Dúnedain and the High Elves of Rivendell.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Hate and is unengaged.

adversaries.name: Orcs of the White Mountains
adversaries.description: After their defeat in the Battle of Azanulbizar, countless Orcs fled south from the Misty Mountains. Many of these took refuge in the White Mountains, becoming a plague on the lands of the Mata until the last of them were finally hunted down and slain by Folca King in 2863. Yet in some hidden fortresses within the least accessible corners of the White Mountains Orcs remain, lean and hungry and kept warm against the cold by the hate burning within their breasts.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Hate and is unengaged.

adversaries.name: Half-Orcs
adversaries.description: The more ill-favoured of Saruman’s creations are the Half-orcs, creatures whose ancestry cannot be disguised. Known also as Man-orcs, they are tall and ferocious, and are often dispatched to assault enemies defending behind an advantageous position, like a shield-wall formation for example, as their reach is longer than that of most Orcs.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Uruk-Hai Soldiers
adversaries.description: Large and heavily muscled with fearsome features, many of these slant-eyed Orcs serve Saruman the White. They are equipped in Isengard, and are clad in heavy iron mail and wield broad short swords. But the Uruk-hai are not crude and savage as other Orcs. They are clever monsters, sent to accomplish delicate missions whose objectives are known only to the mind who plotted them.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.

adversaries.name: Goblin-Men
adversaries.description: Not obviously as Orc-like as the Half-orcs, Goblin-men are able to pass as individuals of a particularly foul appearance and temperament. They often work as spies and emissaries for their master in Orthanc, due to their ability to pass relatively unnoticed in civilised lands. From Bree to Gondor, they skulk in the shadows and listen to idle talk across Middle-earth before returning to Isengard.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, the creature also loses 1 Hate.

adversaries.name: Uruk-Hai Captain
adversaries.description: As tall as Men and wielding terrible weaponry, the captains of the Uruk-hai know no mercy – even towards their own soldiers. They are keen-minded and brutally efficient, driving their ‘lads’ with a combination of cracking whips and promised pain for those who do not follow their orders. Those serving Saruman are unwaveringly loyal to the White Hand and are often the only Orcs in a given company who have any hint at the reasons behind a mysterious command from their master.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all other Uruk-Hai in the fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon (C), it may spend 1 C and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Orcish Wolf-Riders
adversaries.description: In his later schemes against Rohan, Saruman plans to employ companies of Orcs riding Wild Wolves to oppose the horse-riding Rohirrim. These fast riders are particularly suited as scouts and as plunderers, as they can strike swiftly and return.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
When affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, the creature also loses 1 Hate.

adversaries.name: Hobgoblins
adversaries.description: Hobgoblins are an especially malevolent race of Orcs bred in the North in ages past. They are tall and gaunt, with long limbs and flat, almost noseless faces. Only a few members of that fell race survive today, in dark caverns beneath the Grey Mountains and under the Mountains of Mirkwood. Like the smaller Goblins of the mountains, they hate the light of the sun and rarely venture far from their lairs, but are exceedingly powerful at night or when prowling in darkness.

adversaries.name: Marsh Hags
adversaries.description: These solitary monsters appear to be large and twisted Water-goblins, with long arms and iron-hard claws. They are called hags as their heads seem covered by thick tresses of green hair, giving them the appearance of horrible, wicked crones. Marsh-hags hide in watery chambers beneath deep stagnant pools, waiting for an unfortunate traveller to stumble upon their hiding place.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Forest Goblin
adversaries.description: The Orcs of Mirkwood are wiry, pale creatures, mostly inhabiting the caves under the Mountains of Mirkwood and haunting the ruins of Dol Guldur. Their long limbs and bony hands are surprisingly powerful, a characteristic that many enemies discovered too late.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When inside Mirkwood, this creature gains +2 Parry.
At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Hate and is unengaged.

adversaries.name: The Pale Ones
adversaries.description: Long ago, a small tribe of Goblins passed beneath the shadow of the mountains and slipped past the Ents into the gloom of Nan Mordeleb. As they supped on sickly toadstools, they changed, down in the dark. They lost much of their fears and gained a feral cunning vicious even by the standards of their own cruel race.

fell_abilities.ability_description: All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.

adversaries.name: Common Hill Troll
adversaries.description: Hill-Trolls are probably the most common breed of this cruel race, as they prowl desolate areas from the Coldfells in the north to Gorgoroth in the south. They are wild and beastly in battle, prone to bellowing and roaring to intimidate their enemies, but can be disciplined to use simple weapons and armour.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Hill-Troll Chief
adversaries.description: A Troll-chief is a larger, meaner and more intelligent Hill-Troll, a formidable opponent even for the most valorous (or reckless) heroes.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.

adversaries.name: Mountain Troll
adversaries.description: Mountain-Trolls are the largest of all Troll-races, often twelve feet or more in height. Immensely strong and dangerous, luckily they are rarely encountered, and are dull-witted and slow.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight. Those who succeed will continue to gain 1 Shadow point (Dread) each round until they fail a Shadow test.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon (C), it may spend 1 C and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Etins
adversaries.description: Etins are some of the oldest of Troll-kind, barely distinguishable from huge piles of rock. They exhibit abnormal features now lost to the Stone-Trolls, like having four arms, or two heads growing side-by-side from their shoulders.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.

Choose one of the two options: Two-Headed - All rolls made to sneak around or ambush this creature are Ill-favoured. Four-Armed - This creature can Seize two targets at the same time or seize one and still act normally.

adversaries.name: Fungal Troll
adversaries.description: Cave-Trolls that linger too long in the depths of Nan Mordeleb can change nearly beyond recognition, their bodies becoming hosts to swarms of fungal infestations. This softens their hide, making them (somewhat) easier to damage, yet all but inures them to pain. The resulting creatures are terrible to behold and perilous to fight.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If any hero engaged in close combat with this creature wishes to take any action other than attacking, they must spend 1 point of Hope (including Combat Tasks).

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon (C), it may spend 1 C and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Marsh Ogre
adversaries.description: Some of the more terrifying tales surviving in the North talk of horrible man-eating Giants who were said to prowl lonely moors and bogs in search of prey. The most dangerous among them are said to have once lived in the marshes to the east of Mirkwood. No one has seen an Ogre in recent times, and the old and wise among the Men of the Lake say that they retreated among the mists of the bogs when Smaug took residence under the Lonely Mountain - few monsters were a match for a great Dragon! But now Smaug is dead, and the Marsh-ogres could emerge once again from their stinking retreats to threaten Lake-town and its prospering inhabitants.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon (C), it may spend 1 C and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Attercop
adversaries.description: Many-eyed and many-legged, Attercops are giant spiders reaching up to the size of boats. They are crafty predators who attack unwary victims, first tying them up with their spider-thread and then poisoning them. While a single Attercop does not pose a significant threat to any but a less-experienced adventurer, a roused spider-colony can be a challenge even for a veteran company of heroes.

adversaries.name: Hunter Spider
adversaries.description: Spawn of Tauler the Hunter and his sister Sarqin.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
Spend 1 Hate to attack any Player-hero, in any combat stance, including Rearward.
If this creature applies its Poison effect, the victim also falls to the ground paralyzed until the Poison is cured.

adversaries.name: Great Spider
adversaries.description: Great Spiders display their dreadful heritage much more prominently than the lesser Attercops. They are gigantic in size, sometimes as big as horses or greater, but their soft, flexible bodies enable them to hide in surprisingly narrow passages. While they can always be described as monstrous spider creatures, their features often differ from one individual to another: the number and appearance of their legs and eyes may vary, for instance – some are supported by long and thin stalks, others move about on strong and hairy limbs ending in claw-like appendages, some spy from the dark with clustered eyes, and others follow their prey with bulbous, many-windowed eyes. Regardless of the details, Great Spiders are always a terrifying sight.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.

Spend 1 Hate to make one Player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Sorcery). Targets who fail their Shadow test or who are Miserable cannot willingly attack the Great Spider for a number of rounds = 10 - their Wisdom score.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Great Bat
adversaries.description: Unusually large bats, whose taste for blood often leads them to follow when Orcs and Wargs go on raids or to war.

adversaries.name: Elder Vampire
adversaries.description: The largest and most terrible of the winged vampires. These gargantuan bats are the size of a grown man with wings each as long as its body. Their clawed feet tear open the stomach of their victims and their fangs can pierce armor with ease.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
Wounded targets make an Ill-favoured Feat die roll to determine the severity of their injury.

adversaries.name: Secret Shadow
adversaries.description: Taking the form of great misshapen bats, these servants of Sauron fly on their great fingered wings to carry his dark tidings or to spy upon the land, or join a swarm of Great Bats when war or hunt has provided them with prey. These Vampires belong to an astute and patient breed, always aware of the will of their Master and ready to do his bidding. Ages ago they were able to disguise their foul appearance and appear as beautiful women. Today, they may appear as such only briefly, to confound their opponents.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to reduce the Parry score of a player-hero by -2 for one turn.
When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon (C), it may spend 1 C and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
This creature can attack any Player-hero in any combat stance, including Rearward.

adversaries.name: Hill-Men of Rhudaur
adversaries.description: Cruel warriors once serving the Witch-lord of Angmar, they were much reduced in numbers, but they still inhabit the land once ruled by their king. They received many gifts of sorcery, and have not forgotten their allegiance.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When the first Hill-man dies in a combat, ravens swoop down and reduce the Parry rating of all player heroes by -2.
Spend 1 Hate to force a player to gain 1 Shadow point (Sorcery). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, each time they roll a C they lose 1 Hope until the next dusk or dawn.
At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Hate and is unengaged.

adversaries.name: Hill-Men of Gundabad
adversaries.description: These Hill-men are wild warriors of the Black Hills of the Vales of Gundabad. Their ancestors served the Witch-king of Angmar, and they were given to the practice of sorcery. Today they do not serve the Shadow, but should their old master summon them, most of them would readily answer. The Hill-men can leave their bodies while sleeping in the form of spirit-Wargs, to join the wild wolves in their hunts.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
When targeting the subject of their hate, all attacks are Favoured.

adversaries.name: Gundabad Spirit Wargs
adversaries.description: Spirit Warg forms of the Hill Men of Gundabad.

fell_abilities.ability_description: The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
Spend 1 Hate to attack any Player-hero, in any combat stance, including Rearward.
When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Wild Men of Mirkwood
adversaries.description: These men are the descendants of Northmen who fled into the deep forests of Mirkwood and became corrupt and evil. They forgot all their lore, and now use carved wood and chipped stone instead of metal. They speak a barbaric tongue that is part a degenerate form of the Common Speech and part mimicry of the chirps and clicks of the Spiders.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When inside Mirkwood, this creature gains +2 Parry.
When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.

This creature is a thrall of another. When its master is on the field, this creature may spend 1 Hate point to sacrifice itself to absorb an attack for its master. If its master is not on the field this creature loses 1 Hate and becomes Craven.

adversaries.name: Dunlending Raiders
adversaries.description: Sometimes, when a particularly harsh winter has passed or a provocation from the hated Forgoil rouses them, the Men of Dunland assemble war parties and descend swiftly from their hills to plunder and kill, before retreating just as quickly back into the mountain mists where few dare follow them.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.

adversaries.name: Wulfing Riders
adversaries.description: The Wulfings bear the symbols of their mixed ancestry, the old roots of their Dunlendish blood and their Northman heritage. They will draw their blade on anyone who forgets that one of their lords was once king of all Rohan.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.
Spend 1 Resolve to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Warriors of the Gaesela
adversaries.description: Proud in their old ways, the Dunlendings of the west march of Rohan are more peaceful than their kin living in the Dunland Fells, but they are just as quick to draw blood if given a reason.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Resolve to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Men of Isengard
adversaries.description: Many of Saruman’s most trusted servants belong to the folk of Isengard, men and women who have lived all their lives under the shadow of the Tower of Orthanc. Well-fed and trained, they are loyal and dependable.

adversaries.name: Easterling Warrior
adversaries.description: The warriors of the East are fierce and tough. Adorned in bronzed and gilded mail and armed with gleaming curved blades, these foreign fighters are a strange and fearful sight.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Easterling Captain
adversaries.description: Captains in the armies of the East are especially cruel, establishing their authority through fear and pain. They are just as capable of inflicting that pain on their foes.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.
When this creature scores a Piercing Blow, spend 1 Hate to raise the Injury Rating of the weapon by 4.

adversaries.name: Easterling Raider
adversaries.description: Fast and light skirmishing units of the Easterlings are a common sight near the Iron Hills, in Dorwinion, and sometimes in the furthest reaches of Dalish lands. These raiders are fast and brutal, and are masters of both horse and bow.

fell_abilities.ability_description: This creature can only be attacked in Close Combat by a character in Forward Stance.

adversaries.name: Easterling Sorcerer
adversaries.description: Petty sorcery is the fare of dark cultists and secretive courtiers in the kingdoms of the East. Black temples to Morgoth are the training grounds for men and women with knowledge of evil power who use their knowledge to aid in the wars fought in Dark Lord Sauron’s name.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 point of Hate to make one player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Sorcery). Targets who fail their shadow test are stung with blinding pain like a knife through the gut, making them lose (-2d) on all attack rolls, and suffer –4 to their Parry rating.
When this creature deals damage with an attack, the attack target gains 1 Shadow point (Dread).

adversaries.name: Corrupted Dwarf Warrior
adversaries.description: The warriors of the dwarves are fearsome and sturdy. When they lose their minds from shadow corruption, they become a very dangerous threat.

fell_abilities.ability_description: This creature’s Might is considered 1 higher for the purpose of Resisting the Intimidate Foe combat task.
Spend 1 Resolve to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Corrupted Dwarf
adversaries.description: The dwarves are resilient against the corruption of shadow, but they are not immune to the enemy. Many are driven to their own selfish and destructive ends.

adversaries.name: Corrupted Dwarf Veteran
adversaries.description: Experienced dwarven warriors that become corrupted can best several mannish fighters simultaneously, requiring a half-dozen warriors or more to subdue.

fell_abilities.ability_description: This creature’s Might is considered 1 higher for the purpose of Resisting the Intimidate Foe combat task.
Spend 1 Resolve to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.
Spend 1 point of Resolve to recover 6 Endurance points.

adversaries.name: Spectres
adversaries.description: Not all the spirits that tarry in Middle-earth are bound to the service of Sauron, yet all feel the pull of his will. Powerful and strong-willed Men or Elves who died while pursuing acts of passion and great pride are often so consumed by their obsessions that they can linger on after death, haunting places they once used to love or inhabit.

fell_abilities.ability_description: The creature is incorporeal and partially, if not completely, invisible. It cannot normally harm nor can be harmed physically by the living. When this creature's Hate score is reduced to 0, it disappears and reappears the next night with its hate score refilled. Weapons that do not possess Enchanted qualities cannot affect this creature.
Spend 1 Hate to force a player-hero to gain 2 points of Shadow (Sorcery). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are Wounded as an old injury reopens.
Spend 1 Hate to force a player-hero to gain 1 point of Shadow (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they lose a number of Endurance points equal to twice their current Shadow score.

adversaries.name: Bog Soldiers
adversaries.description: Dead soldiers of a war long past, lying in rest beneath the Ettenmoors.

adversaries.name: Wood-Wight
adversaries.description: Spirits from Dol Guldur possessing the bodies of Northmen.

fell_abilities.ability_description: All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
If this creature is encountered in Mirkwood, all BATTLE rolls made to gain combat advantages or remove combat complications are Ill-Favoured.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.

adversaries.name: Dead Men of Dunharrow
adversaries.description: Shades of the men of the mountains, cursed to undeath after betraying their king in the war of the last alliance.

fell_abilities.ability_description: The creature is incorporeal and partially, if not completely, invisible. It cannot normally harm nor can be harmed physically by the living. When this creature's Hate score is reduced to 0, it disappears and reappears the next night with its hate score refilled. Weapons that do not possess Enchanted qualities cannot affect this creature.
Spend 1 Hate to force a player-hero to gain 1 point of Shadow (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they lose a number of Endurance points equal to twice their current Shadow score.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.

adversaries.name: Grim Hawks
adversaries.description: Grim Hawks eat fish and smaller birds, as well as worms and insects they dig out of the mud with their sharp curved beaks. They also eat carrion by placing one clawed foot on the corpse and tearing the flesh with their beaks. A hungry Grim Hawk can be brave enough to attack an armed man, and a flock may surround a group of men.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.
When affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, the creature also loses 1 Hate.

adversaries.name: Basilisks
adversaries.description: Called Sarnlug by the Elves, and Fágwyrm by the Northmen, these lizards are said to be cast-offs from the Enemy’s earliest attempts to make dragons. Most Basilisks are as large as boars, but they can grow much bigger. Their yellowish bellies drag on the ground as they waddle through the forest’s underbrush.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.
When this creature is fighting hated enemies, all of its attack rolls are Favoured.
Spend a point of Hate to force all characters in close combat with this creature to make a Protection Test against TN 14 or be Poisoned.

adversaries.name: Huorns
adversaries.description: Ancient and vengeful tree-like creatures. They are not quite Ents but possess a malevolent will of their own.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When this creature is fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
Spend 1 Hate to summon a mist that forces all player heroes to succeed on a Shadow Test (Sorcery) or lose (2d) on all attack rolls and suffer –2 Parry in this combat.

adversaries.name: Bloodstump the Hunter
adversaries.description: Bloodstump was the Hill-Troll Chief responsible for killing the Chieftain of the Dúnedain, Arador, the grandfather of Aragorn. He wields a terrible weapon, a dark gift from an invisible master.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.
When this creature scores a Piercing Blow, spend 1 Hate to raise the Injury Rating of the weapon by 10.

adversaries.name: The Queen on Castle Hill
adversaries.description: Rine, the self-proclaimed Queen of Castle Hill, is a huge solitary Stone-Troll with fists like boulders and a mind more cunning than most of her kind. Her weakness might lie in the excessive trust she puts in her improvised coat of armor.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.

adversaries.name: Gorgol, Son of Bolg
adversaries.description: Gorgol is a young Great Orc, dreadfully strong but not yet grown to full size and power. What he lacks in might he makes up in cunning.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.
Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all other orcs in this fight.

adversaries.name: Maghaz, Orc-Captain
adversaries.description: The castellan of Fenbridge, in Southern Mirkwood, is a wily creature who has learnt how to survive in the shadow of Dol Guldur: trust no one, never lead openly when you can plot in the dark, obey your masters, and when something goes wrong always find someone to put the blame upon.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is exposed to the full light of the sun.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (1d) on an attack and make the roll Favoured.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Nagrhaw, Chief of the Wargs
adversaries.description: Nagrhaw, Chief of the Wargs is a Wolf Leader of unusual strength and cunning. He is always accompanied by a retinue of Wild Wolves, and sometimes Orcs.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all other wolves in this fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: The New Great Goblin
adversaries.description: The self-styled Greatest Goblin is a lumbering, huge Orc, consumed by an unquenchable thirst for revenge. He will go to any length to bring harm upon the dwellers of the Vales of Anduin, and especially the Beornings, but would go to greater lengths to preserve his own safety.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
When fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.

adversaries.name: Black Warg of Methedras
adversaries.description: A dark spirit inhabits the form of the Black Warg of Methedras, an evil shade that feeds off the breath of the living and is augmented by the deep shadows of the blackest nights.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.

adversaries.name: Stoneclaws the Bear
adversaries.description: Raised from a cub on the draughts of the Ents, Stoneclaws is a (mostly) benevolent sight within the forest. Woe betide any who provoke or attack him, however.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Resolve to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.

adversaries.name: The Great Boar of Everholt
adversaries.description: Is the fabled Boar of Everholt a myth, an undying creature that lives to be hunted and slain only to return to prowl the woods, or is it the progeny of a breed of boars that once every century generates a specimen of prodigious size?

fell_abilities.ability_description: When attacks inflict damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Dreorg the Wargling
adversaries.description: Dreorg the Wargling was once one of the Hill-men living in the vale of Gundabad, to the east of the Misty Mountains. To escape death, his spirit fled his form and entered that of a particularly large, savage Warg.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.
Spend 1 Hate to attack any Player-hero, in any combat stance, including Rearward.

adversaries.name: Radgul the Orc-Chief
adversaries.description: Radgul is the chieftain of the Orcs of Mount Gram, a wily, scarred old Orc with ambitions on the throne of Mount Gundabad and the cunning and patience to achieve his goals.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all other wolves in this fight.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When this creature is fighting hated enemies, all of this creature’s attack rolls are Favoured.

adversaries.name: The Wight-King (Buffed)
adversaries.description: A spirit great and terrible dwells in the greatest mound of the Barrow-downs. Clad in ancient armour that has been pitted and ruined with age, he wields a broken blade with skeletal hands.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to cancel a Wound. When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, spend 1 Hate to bring the creatures back to full Endurance instead. This ability is ineffective against Player-heroes wielding a magical weapon enchanted with spells for the Bane of the Undead.
The creature is not affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, unless a Magical success is obtained.
All attack rolls are Favoured while in darkness.
All Shadow Tests made against this creature's abilities are Ill-Favoured.
Spend 1 Hate to force all player-heroes to succeed on a Shadow Test (Sorcery) or lose (-2d) on all attack rolls and suffer –2 Parry for the rest of the combat.

Spend 1 Hate to force all player-heroes in earshot to gain 3 points of Shadow (Sorcery). Any hero that fails their Shadow Test falls into a deep slumber and are unconscious. They will later be sacrificed in the Wight-King's Barrow.

adversaries.name: The Witch-King of Angmar
adversaries.description: Lord of the Nazgûl and chief servant of Sauron.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Whenever a player-hero spends a point of Hope to gain dice or invoke a virtue, spend 1 Hate to negate it.
Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Sorcery). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are affected by either 'Shadow of Fear' or 'Prohibition'.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)

adversaries.name: The Sorcerer of Forod
adversaries.description: Ringwraith of Rhovanion, seeking to overthrow the kingdom of Erebor.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are affected by 'Shadow of Fear' or 'Terror of Desire'.
At the beginning of each turn, this creature can choose which hero it engages regardless of restrictions, or it can abandon combat entirely. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)
Spend 1 Hate to reduce the Parry score of a player-hero by –2 for one turn. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)

adversaries.name: The Lieutenant of Dol Guldur
adversaries.description: Chief of the 3 ringwraiths of Dol Guldur.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are ensorcelled and made an agent of Shadow.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: The Messenger of Mordor
adversaries.description: The chief messenger of Mordor, equipped with a swift black horse and a raiment to hide his dark undead features.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are also ensorcelled by the ringwraith and made an agent of Shadow. They will follow the orders of the wraith for up to a month. If another hero can succeed on an AWE roll (or another appropriate personality skill) with at least 1 Success icon, they may break this spell's effects.
Spend 1 Hate to reduce the Parry score of a player-hero by –2 for one turn.

adversaries.name: The Ghost of the Forest
adversaries.description: This ringwraith roams Mirkwood unclad and invisible. Its passing can only be detected by a chill in the air and a feeling of terror.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to make a player-hero gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are also ensorcelled by the ringwraith and made an agent of Shadow. They will follow the orders of the wraith for up to a month. If another hero can succeed on an AWE roll (or another appropriate personality skill) with at least 1 Success icon, they may break this spell's effects.
At the beginning of each turn, this creature can choose which hero it engages regardless of restrictions, or it can abandon combat entirely. (ONLY IN GHOST FORM)

adversaries.name: Nazgûl
adversaries.description: The lesser known members of the 9 are still incredibly deadly foes.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the beginning of each turn, this creature can choose which hero it engages regardless of restrictions, or it can abandon combat entirely. (ONLY IN GHOST FORM)

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round. (ONLY IN PHYSICAL FORM)

adversaries.name: The Horse-Eater
adversaries.description: A greater-snow troll of prodigious size with a blunt snout.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.
If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow instead. Then, if the creature is still alive, it returns to full Endurance.
Spend 1 point of Hate to gain +4 Parry for a single round.

adversaries.name: Caselwun
adversaries.description: Leader of a band of Dunlending raiders.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Blodred
adversaries.description: The thirst for vengeance has consumed him, turning Hope to Hate in lesser measure.

adversaries.name: Rhonwen
adversaries.description: Twin sister of Caselwun.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to restore 1 Resolve to all other Warriors in the fight.

adversaries.name: Chosen Dunlending Warriors
adversaries.description: Warriors of the Iron-Folk, loyal to their leaders and fierce in battle.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve point to gain (1d) on an attack and to make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: The Barrow-Witch
adversaries.description: Crone with intimate knowledge of Silver Mere.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to vanish into the mists or bewilder an opponent and make them Weary.

adversaries.name: The Grey Horse
adversaries.description: The malevolent horse-spirit of Silver Mere.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight. Those who succeed will continue to gain 1 Shadow point (Dread) each round until they fail a Shadow test.
When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Hate to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

When the Grey Horse successfully seizes a target with a Bite attack, it drags its target into the water on the next turn. A seized target can escape this with an ATHLETICS roll, though they will also have to swim out of the water if they are dragged in.

adversaries.name: Hirdan, Bandit Leader
adversaries.description: Hirdan is a large and imposing brute with reddish hair, squinting blue eyes and hands scarred from years spent breaking stone in Gondor’s quarries.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to restore 1 Resolve to all of this creature's allies in the fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 Resolve and 1 point of Hate to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Bandits from the South
adversaries.description: Wicked men under the command of Hirdan.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Hate and unengaged.
Spend 1 Resolve point to gain (1d) on an attack and to make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Agents of Mordor
adversaries.description: Wicked Southrons trying to get Horses for Mordor.

adversaries.name: Horse-Lords Spectre
adversaries.description: Ghost of the horse-lord defending his barrow.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the first round of the battle all Player-heroes in sight gain 3 Shadow points (Dread). Those who fail their Shadow test are daunted and cannot spend Hope for the rest of the fight.

Spend 1 Hate point to give a player hero 3 points of Shadow (Sorcery). If the hero fails their Shadow Test, they are considered Weary. If the character fails with a 'C', the character becomes Wounded.

adversaries.name: Gazhur Three-Deaths
adversaries.description: Chief of the Orcs of the High Stone in the White Mountains.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all of this creature's allies in the fight.

If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
Spend 1 point of Hate to gain +4 Parry for a single round.

adversaries.name: Malthor, The Axe-Bitten
adversaries.description: A notable chieftain among the Orcs of the White Mountains.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all of this creature's allies in the fight.
The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is exposed to the full light of the sun.
When targeting player-heroes of the cultures hated by this creature, its attacks are Favoured.

When an attack inflicts damage to this creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, it causes a Piercing Blow. Then, if the creature survives even after failing the Protection Test, they return to full Endurance.

adversaries.name: Thugs
adversaries.description: A trio of caravan guards that are threatening Baldor for supposedly cheating them out of their pay.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Resolve and unengaged.

adversaries.name: Night-Wight
adversaries.description: A thing of shadow, haunting the remains of a warrior who once fell into corruption.

fell_abilities.ability_description: The creature loses 1 Hate at the start of each round it is engaged in close combat with an adversary wielding a torch or other burning item.
All attack rolls are favoured while in darkness.
Spend 1 Hate to cancel a Wound. When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, spend 1 Hate to bring the creatures back to full Endurance.

adversaries.name: The Thing in the Well
adversaries.description: The Nameless Thing inside the Well in the Wood. Not even the Wise might guess where this thing is from or how it came here.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.

adversaries.name: Faron the Trapper
adversaries.description: A grim trapper ordered to shadow Oderic by Valter.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When targeted by an attack, spend 1 Resolve to make the attack roll Ill-favoured.

adversaries.name: Valter the Bloody
adversaries.description: Valter claims to be the descendant of noble kings, but he would be a bloody-handed tyrant if he ever won his kingdom.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to restore 1 Resolve to all other Outlaws in the fight.

adversaries.name: Oderic
adversaries.description: A young Beorning who has betrayed his people to Valter.

fell_abilities.ability_description: When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 Hate and 1 point of Resolve to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Outlaws
adversaries.description: Mean, ill-favoured men from the South. Some ride ugly, half-starved horses.

fell_abilities.ability_description: At the start of the round, the adversary flees the battlefield if at zero Resolve and unengaged.

adversaries.name: Undead Warriors
adversaries.description: Once young and valorous men, the guards of the Alderman have been stripped of their lives and will by the Necromancer’s dark arts.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to cancel a Wound. When an attack inflicts damage to the creature that would cause it to go to zero Endurance, spend 1 Hate to bring the creatures back to full Endurance instead.

adversaries.name: Ghor the Despoiler
adversaries.description: A huge orc-chieftain from the Mountains of Shadow. Leader of the Dwimmerhorn.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to restore 1 Hate to all other Orcs in the fight.

When this creature deals damage to a target with an attack that produces at least one Success icon, it may spend 1 Hate and 1 point of Resolve to immediately make a second attack against that target. This can only occur once per round.

adversaries.name: Easterling Warriors
adversaries.description: These men are mercenaries from the plains to the distant East, drawn to Dol Guldur with promises of bloodshed and fortune.

adversaries.name: Gerold the Beorning
adversaries.description: A wild mercenary fighting in the melee tournament.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve point to gain (1d) on an attack and to make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Elstan, Captain of Dale
adversaries.description: A wild mercenary fighting in the melee tournament.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Resolve to restore 1 Resolve to all other Elstan Followers in the fight.
Spend 1 Resolve point to gain (1d) on an attack and to make the roll Favoured.

adversaries.name: Elstan’s Followers
adversaries.description: Men of Dale fighting for Elstan in the tournament.

adversaries.name: The Gibbet King
adversaries.description: The host body of the jailer for the Necromancer of Dol Guldur.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Spend 1 Hate to reduce the Parry score of a player-hero by –2 for one turn.

The creature is not affected by the Intimidate Foe combat task, unless a Magical success is obtained.

Whenever a player-hero is Wounded or is reduced to 0 Endurance, this creature gains 1 Hate.

adversaries.name: Snow Trolls
adversaries.description: Snow-trolls are smaller than many of their brethren, but their ferocity makes up for the difference in size. They are usually found in caves, where they slumber waiting for a snowstorm to arrive.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.

adversaries.name: Raenar the Cold-Drake
adversaries.description: Raenar is a monster bred in another age of the world. Once grown back to full stature, there will be no match for his strength in the North, now that Smaug is dead.

fell_abilities.ability_description: If the creature scored a Piercing Blow with a close combat attack, spend 1 Hate to make the target’s Protection roll Ill-favoured.
Spend 1 Hate point to gain (2d) on a Protection roll.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Bojaźliwość. Gdy znajdziesz się pod wpływem zadania bojowego Przeraź Wroga, tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści.
Jeżeli twój atak zada Ranę, cel zostaje zatruty (efekty działania trucizny opisano na stronie 134).

adversaries.description: Tylko najbardziej niegodziwi i okrutni orkowie żyją na tyle długo, by dochrapać się pozycji herszta i dowodzić swoim plemieniem albo bandą w bitwach. Hersztów łatwo rozpoznać: są zwykle najwięksi, mają najstraszliw-szy oręż i najokazalszą zbroję. Często noszą też pamiątki długiej służby u Władcy Ciemności – blizny i okaleczenia.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test trafienia.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Nienawiści pozostałym orkom w potyczce.

adversaries.name: Ork - żołdak
adversaries.description: Orkowi żołnierze, zwykle zbrojni w niemożliwe do pomylenia krzywe szable, są wrzaskliwi i nieposłuszni. By utrzymać wśród nich dyscyplinę, niezbędny jest silny herszt, okrutny bat i ostry nóż.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Bojaźliwość. Gdy znajdziesz się pod wpływem zadania bojowego Przeraź Wroga, tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści.

Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test trafienia.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Nienawiści pozostałym orkom w potyczce.

adversaries.name: Wielki ork - obrońca
adversaries.description: Potwory o rozumie słabszym niż sprytni wodzowie, za cenę życia bronią swoich przywódców.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Nie można wyrządzić ci krzywdy gołymi rękami. Nadto, gdy atak zada ci dość obrażeń, by zmniejszyć twoją Wytrzymałość do zera, zamiast tego powoduje Przełamanie Obrony. Jeśli przeżyjesz, twoja Wytrzymałość wzrasta do połowy maksymalnej wartości.

adversaries.name: Wielki troll jaskiniowy
adversaries.description: Ta ogromna bestia, której lękają się nawet poganiacze, służy orkom do rozbijania obrony oraz miażdzenia ducha najgroźniejszych nawet wrogów.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by wszyscy Bohaterowie w zasięgu wzroku otrzymali 2 punkty Cienia (Groza). Postaci, którym nie uda się Próba Cienia, są przerażone i przez resztę potyczki nie mogą wydawać Nadziei.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by dodać (2k) do testu PANCERZA.

adversaries.name: Troll jaskiniowy - niuchacz
adversaries.description: Ta odmiana trolla jaskiniowego jest nieco mniejsza od innych, choć wciąż przewyższa rozmiarami orków. Niuchacze doskonale radzą sobie głęboko pod ziemią, polując samotnie i w zupełnej ciemności – jak nikt potrafią bowiem zwęszyć ofiarę.

fell_abilities.ability_description: W ciemnościach wszystkie twoje rzuty za atak są Wzmocnione.
Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by dodać (2k) do testu PANCERZA.

adversaries.name: Troll kamienny - łupieżca
adversaries.description: Choć taki troll wygląda równie straszliwie, jak inni przedstawiciele tego rodzaju, wydaje się mniej potworny – a to dla tej przyczyny, że ma w zwyczaju nosić zgrzebne ubrania, gotować posiłki i używać prostych narzędzi, na przykład kubków i beczek.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Gdy walczysz z krasnoludami, twoje testy ataku zostają Wzmocnione.
Jeżeli Przełamałeś Obronę wroga atakiem wręcz, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test PANCERZA trafionego nieprzyjaciela.

adversaries.name: Troll kamienny - wódz
adversaries.description: Zdarza się, że na czele grupy kamiennych trollów staje najsilniejszy jej członek. Pod jego wodzą banda napada na kupców i samotne domostwa.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Gdy walczysz z krasnoludami, twoje testy ataku zostają Wzmocnione.
Jeżeli Przełamałeś Obronę wroga atakiem wręcz, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test PANCERZA trafionego nieprzyjaciela.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Nienawiści pozostałym orkom w potyczce.

adversaries.name: Upiór kurhanu
adversaries.description: Upiory kurhanów przybyły na wzgórza Tyrn Gorthad z rozkazu Czarnoksiężnika z Angmaru, by wesprzeć go w wojnach przeciw królestwu Arnoru. Objawiają się jako wysokie i mroczne postaci o zimnych oczach pałających bladym światłem. Na kościanych palcach noszą pierścienie, a wokół zwiędłych szyi owijają złote łańcuchy. W dłoniach dzierżą pradawne, wyszczerbione miecze.

fell_abilities.ability_description: W ciemnościach wszystkie twoje rzuty na atak są Wzmocnione.

Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by jeden z Bohaterów otrzymał 3 punkty Cienia (Czarnoksięstwo). Jeżeli celowi nie uda się Próba Cienia albo pogodził się z Przypiętnieniem, reakcją przeciwników może go gubić wykrzykiwana testująca PIEŚŃ. Sam onśnie się ogólnie.
Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści w każdej turze, w której oświetlają cię bezpośrednio promienie słońca.

adversaries.name: Złowroga zjawa
adversaries.description: Złowroga zjawa przyjmuje postać wędrowca, przemierzającego dawne ruiny, zgarbionego i okutango w płaszcz z kapturem, pod którym kryje oblicze upiora. Ciało ma niemal przezroczyste, a jej oczy lśnią jak rozżarzone węgle. Napatkana o zmroku może ująć za człowieka, potrafi bowiem mówić, choć głos ma syczący, a wymowę – dziwaczną. Złowrogie zjawy nie rozstają się ze starożytną bronią i potłuczonymi tarczami, pamiątkami dawnych wojen. Władają nimi z przerażającą wprawą.

fell_abilities.ability_description: W ciemnościach wszystkie twoje rzuty na atak są Wzmocnione.
Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.

adversaries.name: Istota z bagien
adversaries.description: Istoty z bagien to niezdborne, czekokopodobne stwory o chorobliwej, bladej skórze – jak u zwłok, które zbyt długo leżały w wodzie. Ale paskudny blask ich malutkich oczu zdradza ogromną wniośliwość i głęboką niegodziwość. Żyją pośród ruin, w dawnych siedzibach ludzi, najczęściej w pobliżu rozlewisk ciemnej, zatęchłej wody. Kryją się pod ziemią w niewielkich grupach, zawsze gotowe porwać nieświadomych wędrowców i zaciągnąć do głębokich piwnic, gdzie z upodobaniem gromadzą złoto.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.
Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści w każdej turze, w której oświetlają cię bezpośrednio promienie słońca.

adversaries.name: Dziki wilk
adversaries.description: To przeciętnych rozmiarów warg, tylko nieco większy od zwyczajnego wilka – ale po stokroć bardziej zajadły. Zwykle trzyma się watahy, ale czasem napotkać można samotnego myśliwego albo zwiadowcę, gotowego ostrzec innych wargów i różne inne istoty przenikliwym wyciem, które niesie się na wiele mil. Orkowie dosiadają czasem dzikich wilków tak, jak ludzie koni.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.
Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test trafienia.

adversaries.name: Przewodnik watahy
adversaries.description: Przewodnik watahy góruje nad pozostałymi wargami rozmiarem, okrucieństwem i sprytem – dlatego stado gromadzi się przy nim w chwilach zagrożenia, na przykład, kiedy jego terytorium naruszy banda wędrownych poszukiwaczy przygód. Przewodnik nigdy nie wędruje sam i spotkać go można tylko w otoczeniu zgrai dzikich wilków.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.
Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test trafienia.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Nienawiści pozostałym wargom w potyczce.

adversaries.name: Pies Saurona
adversaries.description: Pies Saurona to zaufany sługa Władcy Ciemności, wybrany przez wzgląd na brutalność i szczególnie pokrętny umysł. Zawsze realizuje konkretne zadanie: gromadzi siły na zbliżającą się wojnę, poluje na określoną osobę albo bada jakiś teren. Choć wygląda jak zwyczajny warg, w jego ciele drzemie daleko straszliwsza siła.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Ranione przez ciebie cele wykonują Osłabiony rzut kością Działania, sprawdzając stopień Rany.

Nie można wyrazić ci krzywdy gołymi rękami. Nadto, gdy atak zada ci osobę zbronią, by zmniejszyć twoją Wytrzymałość o 2, zamiast tego wykonuje Przełamanie Obrony. Jeśli przetrwasz, twoja Wytrzymałość wzrasta do połowy maksymalnej wartości.

Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by wszyscy Bohaterowie w zasięgu wzroku otrzymali 2 punkty Cienia (Groza). Postaci, którym nie uda się Próba Cienia są przerażone i przez resztę potyczki nie mogą używać Nadziei.

adversaries.name: Zbir
adversaries.description: Tchórzliwy bandyta, który bez wahania obrabuje bezbronną ofiarę, ale na samotnego poszukiwacza przygód zasadza się wyłącznie z kamratami.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Gdy znajdziesz się pod wpływem Zadania Bojowego Przerazić Wroga, tracisz 1 punkt Determinacji.

adversaries.name: Herszt bandytów
adversaries.description: Naczelny bandyta jest silniejszy i bardziej zaciekły niż kamraci. Na swoją pozycję zapracował albo bystrością, albo pięścią.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Wydaj 1 punkt Determinacji, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Determinacji pozostałym bandytom w potyczce.

adversaries.name: Rozbójnik
adversaries.description: Rozbójnik jest daleko groźniejszy niż zwykły bandyta: nawykł do życia w dzikich ostępach i wie, jak radzić sobie z uzbrojonymi ofiarami.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Determinacji, by Osłabić test trafienia.

adversaries.name: Najeźdźca z Południa
adversaries.description: Gdy mija szczególnie ciężka zima, ludziom z Południa zdarza się zbierać w zbrojne bandy, które z zaskoczenia napadają na samotne domostwa, grabia je i co rychlej rozpływają się we mgle, z której się wyłoniły.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Wydaj 1 punkt Determinacji, by dodać (1k) i Wzmocnić rzut na atak.

adversaries.name: Mocarz z Południa
adversaries.description: Mocarzem z Południa może być z równym powodzeniem wódz plemienia z Dunlandu, przywódca bandytów, który połączył poważniejsze bandy rabusiów w niewielką armię, albo po prostu szczególnie tęgi zbir.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Wydaj 1 punkt Determinacji, by dodać (1k) i Wzmocnić rzut na atak.

adversaries.name: Búrzgul
adversaries.description: Wojowniczy Búrzgul jest nikczemnym orkiem, wodzem obszarpanej bandy, która zeszła aż z Bramy Goblinów w Górach Mglistych, by dołączyć do wilków z Ciemnych Jam. Usłyszał o tym miejscu od swego najbardziej zaufanego kamrata, ogromnego warga imieniem Szlaka, o futrze czarnym jak noc i płonących żółtych oczach. Jak na razie nikt, nawet Strażnicy Północy, nie ma pojęcia, że na Południowych Wzgórzach zaległo się nowe zagrożenie. Orkowie i wilki czekają na jakąś większą sposobność, póki co przeprowadzili tylko kilka świetnie obmyślonych ataków, z których nikt nie uszedł z życiem. Najgorsze jest jednak to, że Búrzgul regularnie się posłańców do większych skupisk orków w Angmarze i Górach Mglistych, więc nowiny z Bree bardzo szybko docierają do uszu agentów Cienia.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Jeżeli twój atak zada Ranę, cel zostaje zatruty (efekty działania trucizny opisano na stronie 134).
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by przywrócić po 1 punkcie Nienawiści pozostałym orkom w potyczce.
Gdy jesteś atakowany, wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści, by Osłabić test trafienia.

adversaries.name: Szlaka
adversaries.description: Szlaka to ogromny warg o futrze czarnym jak noc i płonących żółtych oczach. Jest zaufanym kamratem Búrzgula, z którym razem planują ataki z ukrycia. Potrafi poruszać się w ciszy i niespodziewanie atakować z wielką zajadłością, łącząc zęby i pazury w śmiertelnych kombinacjach.

fell_abilities.ability_description: Tracisz 1 punkt Nienawiści na początku każdej rundy, gdy jesteś związany walką wręcz z przeciwnikiem niosącym pochodnię albo inny płonący przedmiot.
Wydaj 1 punkt Nienawiści po ataku Zębiskami, by natychmiast zaatakować ten sam cel Pazurami.
